page.title: 12CLUBS..RECREATIONS
page.content: The Kelty Community housed in the Old Church has been added to in 1983. The old and new combining to make a spacious area which houses the varied activities and facilities offered. It has a full time Community Leader who controls the Part Time Staff and is directly responsible to the Manpower Committee which runs the service. The Programme caters from Toddlers to Playgroup, from under 14 to over 14 Youth Clubs, to Senior Citizens Clubs. They have teams in Table Tennis, Badminton, Tennis and Ski outings with resedential workshops. Whist and Dominoes for adult groups who also enjoy Leathercraft, Pottery, Needlework, Dressmaking,Pottery classes. The unemployed have started their own club using all the varied activities with weekly talks on Welfare Rights.
